Submodules

qudipy.utils.constants module

Module with universal constants, and Material dataclass for material-specific parameters and dependencies.

@author: simba, zach, hromecb

qudipy.utils.helpers module

General helper utilities

@author: simba

class qudipy.utils.helpers.ProgressBar(max_value, disable=True)

Bases: object

This class is designed to display a progress bar in terminal or a jupyter notebook which is condionally updated.

Atributes

max_value: int

provide the maximum number of iterations that the progress bar must display

pbar:

design progress bar

update:

update porgress bar

close:

close progress bar once sub-routine is finished

close()
pbar()
update(update_value)
qudipy.utils.helpers.find_nearest(array, value)

Function to find the closest value to a number in a given array. If array contains duplicate values of the nearest number, then first instance in the array will be returned.

Parameters:

  • array (ND float array-like object) – An ND array type object of floats.

  • value (float) – Value which we want to find the closest number to in the array.

Returns:

  • near_idx (tuple of ints) – Tuple of indices for the nearest value in array.

  • near_value (float) – Nearest value in array.

qudipy.utils.helpers.nchoosek(n, k)

Had a lot of trouble getting scipy comb to work, so just copied one from stack exchange. This function calculates the number of combinations of k elements from a set of n items.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Total number of items in set.

  • k (int) – Size of subset to make out of the full set.

Returns:

The number of possible combinations.

Return type:

nCr

qudipy.utils.interpolator module

class qudipy.utils.interpolator.NDInterpolator(coords, data, base=10, method='linear')

Bases: LinearNDInterpolator

Class is a wrapper for the LinearNDInterpolator class which performs linear interpolation in a linear or log space. This wrapper class enables the interpolation object computed and pickled for later use.

class qudipy.utils.interpolator.RegularInterpolator(coords: list[numpy.ndarray], data: ndarray, method: str = 'linear', logspace: bool = False, bounds_error: bool = False, fill_value: float = None)

Bases: RegularGridInterpolator

Class is a wrapper for the RegularGridInterpolator class which performs linear interpolation in a linear or log space over a rectilinear array of data (coordinate spacing could be uneven as long as the grid is rectangular). This wrapper class enables the interpolation object computed and pickled for later use.

For data that exponentially depends on the coordinates, it is recommended to interpolate over the logarithms of data, and return the exponential of the interpolated values (logspace=True keyword)

Attributes:

grid: tuple of ndarrays The points defining the regular grid in n dimensions. This tuple defines the full grid via

>>> np.meshgrid(*grid, indexing='ij')

values: ndarray Data values at the grid.

Bases: object

qudipy.utils.units module

Custom types for units. Used throughout the code

qudipy.utils.units.units(*args)

Function used to convert units that assumes starting unit is SI system. Input must be a tuple/list of strings.

Required Parameters

unit: str

Select the unit label to use.

Optional Parameters

prefix: str

Define the prefix that scales the unit that is choosen.

returns:

  • scale (float) – scale the original unit to convert to desired unit_label.

  • unit_label (str) – label of the unit that was converted to from SI unit.

Module contents

Code for utility functions, classes and core functions for code
